meanings.definition: A collective community in Israel where members live and work together.
meanings.sent1: The kibbutz was a place where everyone helped each other.
meanings.sent2: I visited a kibbutz during my trip to Israel.
meanings.sent3: The kibbutz members had a big party to celebrate their hard work.
meanings.sent4: In the kibbutz of life, we all work together for a common goal.
meanings.sent5: The kibbutz buzzed with activity from dawn till dusk.

meanings.definition: To live in or establish a kibbutz.
meanings.sent1: They decided to kibbutz in the countryside.
meanings.sent2: Many young people dream of kibbutzing in Israel.
meanings.sent3: Let's kibbutz and build our own community!
meanings.sent4: She kibbutzed her way into a new way of life.
meanings.sent5: Kibbutzing together made them feel like a family.

meanings.definition: The system or principles of a kibbutz.
meanings.sent1: The kibbutz ideology focused on equality and cooperation.
meanings.sent2: Learning about the kibbutz ethos was fascinating.
meanings.sent3: Their commitment to the kibbutz way of life was unwavering.
meanings.sent4: The kibbutz philosophy inspired many other communities.
meanings.sent5: The kibbutz values shaped their daily routines.
